review: For the ultra low cost of $35, this is a no brainer to try out.  I was glad I did.  As an Apple TV owner, I had some difficulties when doing the screen mirroring as it (the Apple TV), for some reason, didn't want to work on my 5Ghz wireless channel.  The Chromecast not only worked on the 5Ghz channel, but was super easy to set up.  The instructions are very intuitive and I expect anyone with minimal computer skills to be able to do so without any headache.After months of owning this little thing, I've discovered that my only use for it is the tab casting feature.  With more expensive devices like Apple TV, Xbox, and Roku, you don't need a computer or mobile device to control it like you do with Chromecast.  But being able to cast one of my Chrome tabs to my large LCD screen has proven to be very useful when I'm streaming sports that are, otherwise, unavailable on broadcast television in my area.If you're looking to watch Netflix, YouTube, and Hulu... you may want to look at another product as they're far more convenient and don't require an additional device like a computer, tablet, or phone.  If you're looking to extend your online experience to your TV, Chromecast is the cheapest and most convenient solution you'll find.Love it!
